results.adx_keywords: United States Politics and Government;Midterm Elections (2022);Classified Information and State Secrets;Trump, Donald J;Federal Bureau of Investigation;Republican Party;Senate;House of Representatives
results.title: Republicans Signal Worries About Trump and the Midterms
results.abstract: Few Republicans appeared on the major Sunday talk shows to defend the former president. Those who did indicated that they would rather be talking about almost anything else.

media.caption: Senator Roy Blunt, Republican of Missouri, has questioned the timing of the F.B.I.’s search of former President Donald J. Trump’s Mar-a-Lago estate.
media.copyright: Pete Marovich for The New York Times

results.title: 2 Killed in Shooting at Oregon Shopping Center, Police Say
results.abstract: The 20-year-old gunman, who fired multiple times inside a grocery store, was also found dead. At least two people were wounded.

media.caption: Law enforcement personnel outside the Forum Shopping Center in Bend, Ore., after a shooting on Sunday.

results.title: Nebraska School Shuts Down Student Newspaper After L.G.B.T.Q. Publication
results.abstract: In its final edition, the paper at a high school in Grand Island, Neb., published two opinion columns focused on L.G.B.T.Q. issues.

media.caption: Marcus Pennell, left, and Emma Smith display a Pride flag outside Northwest High School in Grand Island, Neb. They both worked on the school’s student newspaper, which administrators shut down.

results.title: Trump’s Legal Team Scrambles to Find an Argument

results.byline: By Jacey Fortin and Eliza Fawcett
results.title: How Bad Is the Teacher Shortage? Depends Where You Live.
results.abstract: Urgently needed: teachers in struggling districts, certified in math or special education. Perks: maybe a pay raise, or how about a four-day week?

media.caption: Hallsville Intermediate School in Hallsville, Mo. The superintendent of the school district there said the pool of qualified teaching applicants has all but dried up in recent years.

results.title: Uma Pemmaraju, an Original Fox News Channel Anchor, Dies at 64
results.abstract: She convinced her Indian parents to allow her to pursue journalism as a career, then went on to win three Emmy Awards.

media.caption: Uma Pemmaraju in 2016. In her nearly 20 years at the Fox News Channel she hosted programs like “Fox News Now,” “Fox on Trends,” the Sunday edition of “Fox News Live” and “The Fox Report.”

results.title: Inmate Who Was Pregnant Settles Suit Over Stop at Starbucks en Route to a Hospital
results.abstract: The woman, who lost her pregnancy, won a $480,000 settlement arising from a suit that said jail employees did not respond for two hours to requests for help after her water broke.

media.caption: A former inmate at the Central Women’s Jail in Orange County, Calif., who lost her pregnancy settled a negligent treatment lawsuit for $480,000.

results.title: Would You Take Out a Loan to Buy This Week’s Groceries?
results.abstract: Americans are increasingly turning to “buy now, pay later” services for food and other everyday essentials. And there are signs that the practice is putting some in deep debt.

media.caption: “Buy now, pay later” services, which allow consumers to pay for goods in installments, often without interest, have become increasingly common for food purchases.
media.copyright: Chona Kasinger for The New York Times

media.caption: The Space Launch System and Orion capsule on Friday. The rocket is scheduled to lift off for the uncrewed Artemis I mission on Monday.

results.abstract: Matt Chandler’s leave of absence from the Village Church near Dallas comes as Southern Baptists are already facing challenges.

results.title: The ‘MacGyvered’ Weapons in Ukraine’s Arsenal
results.abstract: The Ukrainian military has battled Russia with retrofitted equipment, including missiles and rocket systems mounted on trucks and speedboats, experts and officials say.

media.caption: A satellite image shows the damage after a Ukrainian strike on the Saki airfield in Crimea. Eight Russian fighter jets were destroyed.

results.title: Over Caves and Over Budget, Mexico’s Train Project Barrels Toward Disaster
results.abstract: Pitched as a way to develop the country’s poorest region, the Maya Train is threatened by a ballooning budget and rushed construction over fragile terrain. But Mexico’s president has refused to slow it down.

media.caption: A landslide at a construction site for the Mayan Train, before the route was changed to travel through the jungle, in Playa del Carmen, Mexico.

results.title: Trump Request for Special Master Could Open Door for Delays to Investigation
